name: Design Workflow - Moodboard First
description: When building UI, create visual artifacts before writing code: moodboard → mockups → implementation

condition.when: Starting UI/UX design work for a product or feature

required_order: 1. Competitor Research - analyze 5-6 competitors, document features/UX patterns
2. Competitive Analysis Board - create Want/Don't Want annotations
3. Define Keywords - choose 4-5 adjectives for visual direction
4. Moodboard - create in Pencil with color, typography, imagery, UI elements
5. Review & Approval - validate direction before mockups
6. Mockups in Pencil - design screens based on approved moodboard
7. Implementation - build React/code components from approved mockups

sections: Color Palette (5-7 colors with hex codes, primary/secondary/accent roles)
Imagery Style (photo treatments, illustration style, icon style)
UI Elements (buttons, cards, inputs - for feel, not features)

rationale: Creating visual mockups FIRST allows faster iteration on layout/design decisions without code overhead, better stakeholder alignment before dev time, and clearer visual direction. Moodboards prevent generic designs and ensure consistent visual direction.
anti_patterns: Jumping straight to code without visual design
Mixing competitor features into moodboard (keep moodboard about visuals, not features)
Skipping moodboard and going straight to mockups
source: User-established workflow after moodboard research session
